description.narrative:
GALZ is the leading LGBTIQ organisation in Zimbabwe. Sida will provide core support to the organisation during the period October 2021-December 2024, for implementing its strategic plan, which is divided into four thematic priorities: The five-year strategic plan of GALZ has one overall aim: "A just society that promotes and protects human rights of LGBTIQ people as equal citizens in Zimbabwe. The strategy has four priority pillars:
1. Membership and Community Empowerment
2. Knowledge, Documentation and Ideas
3. Policy, Law, Human Rights and Access to Justice
4. The GALZ Home: Governance, Institutional

GALZ är den ledande HBTIQ-organisationen i Zimbabwe. Sida har i omgångar finansierat insatser som genomförts av GALZ - senast under perioden 2018-2021. Denna gång föreslår Sida dock ett mer långsiktigt kärnstöd till organisationen för perioden Oktober 2021-December 2024. HBTIQ-personer är fortsatt en mycket utsatt grupp i det zimbabwiska samhället, där homo- och transfobin är utbredd. Det demokratiska utrymmet för civilsamhällesaktörer är hotat, och ett krympande antal internationella givare och oviljan bland dessa att bidra med kärnstöd gör att flertalet organisationer inom det zimbabwiska civilsamhället står inför stora utmaningar. Ytterst lite utrymme ges från givarna att också utveckla organisationernas hållbarhet och motståndskraft.
Organisationens nya femåriga strategiska plan är uppdelad i fyra tematiska prioriteringar:
1. Stärka HBTIQ-rörelsen i landet.
2. Bygga kunskap och utveckla idéer
3. Policy, lagstiftning, mänskliga rättigheter och tillgång till rättvisa
4. Stärka GALZ som institution

The five-year strategic plan of GALZ has one overall aim: "A just society that promotes and protects human rights of LGBTIQ people as equal citizens in Zimbabwe. The strategy has four priority pillars:
1. Membership and Community Empowerment - Expected outcomes:
- An all-inclusive empowered movement
- Increase in LGBTIQ persons who demand social justice and inclusion
- Reduced gender based and sexuality related violence, stigma and discrimination of LGBTIQ persons
2. Knowledge, Documentation and Ideas
- Enabling policy and operational environment for LGBTIQ persons and organisations
- Publishing of positive media reports by journalists
- Increased number of community members sharing their stories
- Improved knowledge on gender and sexuality diversity among community members
3. Policy, Law, Human Rights and Access to Justice
- Strengthened coalitions advocating for LGBTIQ rights
- Strengthened legal strategy for LGBTIQ organisations in Zimbabwe
- Improved high level political advocacy engagements
- Strengthened partnerships with national, regional and international bodies
- Improved quality and uptake of sexual and reproductive health services and commodities by LGBTIQ persons
4. The GALZ Home: Governance, Institutional
- Improved governance and compliance to organizational policies aligned to the new strategic plan
- Increased long-term funding for the organisation
